instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
This arrived with fast fan spin and unable to load the O.S.  Data already backed up before the issue started. 

<TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR> was shorted and getting excessively hot. Removed <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR> but since it was welded to the board from the short replacing it is not possible.

Fans spin fast within couple minutes of power on. Previous shop ripped <TRANSISTOR>Q6000</TRANSISTOR>. Replaced and all traces are good however still fast fan. Resistors measure good.

When trying to load os recovery the apple logo and progress bar will disappear within  a few minutes with the blinking question mark folder.

Drive is visible when holding option. Windows section will crash within a few minutes. Mac os installer  goes to  question mark folder after the progress bar finishes.

Customer wants only mac os now. Changed bios as well but no change. Is this looking like bad SSD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
Test starting in safe mode.
Also check if any error pops up in diagnostic mode.

Can you load preinstalled USB macOS?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
Diagnostic mode says there may be a problem with the SMC

When trying to load from a preinstalled USB macos a critical software update is required but an error was encountered appears.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boot issue
threads.message:
Seems to have a problem with internal SSD.

BTW, post a screenshot of diagnostic mode eror.
There is an error code and some related message.
